name: app
description: API architecture on top of feathers.

doc.description: A function which starts an app, killing the process if initialize or start fails.
doc.name: run

doc.comment:
/**
* Finds the given value in an array, then returns the adjacent value.
* Adjacent values are wrapped if the next index is out of range.
* Can also be bound, in which case the first argument would be shifted to 'this'
*
* @param {Array|Object} haystack  Array or ArrayLike haystack
* @param {*}            needle    Value to get adjacent of
* @param {number}      [delta=1]  Number of neighbouring indexes to jump
*
* @return {*}                     Adjacent Value
*/
doc.description:
Finds the given value in an array, then returns the adjacent value.
Adjacent values are wrapped if the next index is out of range.
Can also be bound, in which case the first argument would be shifted to 'this'

params.description: Number of neighbouring indexes to jump
params.name: delta

doc.name: adjacent

doc.comment:
/**
 * Does an object have a numeric length?
 *
 * @param  {*} object
 * @return {boolean}   True if input has numeric length property
 */
doc.description: Does an object have a numeric length?

returns.description: True if input has numeric length property

doc.name: hasNumericLength

doc.comment:
/**
 * Is the input an array-like object? Distinct from hasNumericLength because this
 * method only returns true for objects with a length property.
 * Primitive strings will return false, but boxed strings will return true.
 *
 * @param  {*} object
 * @return {boolean}   True if input is an object with numeric length property
 */
doc.description:
Is the input an array-like object? Distinct from hasNumericLength because this
method only returns true for objects with a length property.
Primitive strings will return false, but boxed strings will return true.

returns.description: True if input is an object with numeric length property

doc.name: isArrayLike

doc.comment:
/**
 * Is an object iterable?
 *
 * @param  {*} object
 * @return {boolean}   True if input has Symbol.iterator
 */
doc.description: Is an object iterable?
doc.name: isIterable

doc.comment:
/**
 * pluck - removes a number of items from an array that pass a test
 *
 * @param  {Array} arr                 array to mutate
 * @param  {Function} test             predicate to run on each item
 * @param  {number} count = arr.length max number of items
 * @return {Array}                     items removed via test
 */
doc.description: pluck - removes a number of items from an array that pass a test

params.description: predicate to run on each item
params.name: test

doc.name: pluck

doc.comment:
/**
 * Randomly re-arranges a given array. Can also be bound.
 *
 * @param  {Array} array Array to be sorted.
 * @return {Array}       Array is mutated in place, but method returns it anyway.
 */
doc.description: Randomly re-arranges a given array. Can also be bound.

returns.description: Array is mutated in place, but method returns it anyway.

doc.name: shuffle

doc.comment:
/**
 * create an array reduced to unique values
 *
 * @param  {Array|ArrayLike|Iterable} input Object to reduced
 * @return {Array}       array reduced to unique values
 */
doc.description: create an array reduced to unique values
doc.name: unique

doc.comment:
/**
 * Unwraps an array.
 *
 * @param  {type} arr Object to unwrap.
 * @return {type}     If input is an array, returns the first value, otherwise
 *                    returns the input.
 */
doc.description: Unwraps an array.

returns.description:
If input is an array, returns the first value, otherwise
                   returns the input.

doc.name: unwrap

doc.comment:
/**
 * Wraps an input in an Array, if it isn't an array already.
 *
 * @param  {type} arr Object to wrap.
 * @return {type}     If input is an array, returns the input, otherwise returns
 *                    an array with the input as the first value.
 */
doc.description: Wraps an input in an Array, if it isn't an array already.

returns.description:
If input is an array, returns the input, otherwise returns
                   an array with the input as the first value.

doc.name: wrap

name: dev
description: Test helpers for the rest of @benzed packages.

name: immutable
description: My own library for manipulating objects immutably.

doc.comment:
/**
 * Returns a recursive duplicate of the input.
 *
 * If the input has a symbolic COPY or string copy method, it's output is
 * returned.
 *
 * Otherwise, the copy is made by assigning string and symbol properties to new
 * objects.
 *
 * In the case of arrays, maps and sets, new instances are returned with their
 * iteration results as arguments.
 *
 * @param  {*} value Object or value to copy.
 * @return {*}       Copied value or object.
 */
doc.description:
Returns a recursive duplicate of the input.

If the input has a symbolic COPY or string copy method, it's output is
returned.

Otherwise, the copy is made by assigning string and symbol properties to new
objects.

In the case of arrays, maps and sets, new instances are returned with their
iteration results as arguments.
doc.name: copy

doc.comment:
/**
 * Compares value equality of two inputs.
 *
 * Two operands are considered value equal if they:
 *
 * - Are equal primitives.
 *
 * - Are both NaN.
 *
 * - Implement symbolic EQUALS or string 'equals' method, which returns
 * true when given the opposing operand as input.
 *
 * - Are both objects with value equal string and symbolic keys.
 *
 * - Are both arrays with order and value equal items.
 *
 * - Are reference equal.
 *
 * @param  {*} a Left hand operand.
 * @param  {*} b Right hand operand.
 * @return {boolean} True if two elements are value equal, false if not.
 */
doc.description:
Compares value equality of two inputs.

Two operands are considered value equal if they:

- Are equal primitives.

- Are both NaN.

- Implement symbolic EQUALS or string 'equals' method, which returns
true when given the opposing operand as input.

- Are both objects with value equal string and symbolic keys.

- Are both arrays with order and value equal items.

- Are reference equal.

returns.description: True if two elements are value equal, false if not.

doc.name: equals

doc.comment:
/**
 * Immutable version of Array.prototype.push.
 * Input Array is unscathed.
 *
 * @param {Array} obj       Array or ArrayLike to copy.
 * @param {*}     ...items  Items to push.
 * @return {Array}          Copied Array with pushed items.
 */
doc.description:
Immutable version of Array.prototype.push.
Input Array is unscathed.
doc.name: push

name: math
description: My own personal Math module, extending Math with overridden or custom functionality.

doc.comment:
/**
 * Clamps a value between a min and a max.
 *
 * Can also be bound, in which case 'this' becomes the clamped number, and the
 * min and max params are shifted down.
 *
 * @param  {number} value Value to clamp.
 * @param  {number} min
 * @param  {number} max
 * @return {number}         Clamped number.
 */
doc.description:
Clamps a value between a min and a max.

Can also be bound, in which case 'this' becomes the clamped number, and the
min and max params are shifted down.
doc.name: clamp

doc.comment:
/**
 * Determines if a number is prime.
 *
 * @param  {number} value Value to test.
 * @return {boolean}      True if value is prime, false otherwise.
 */
doc.description: Determines if a number is prime.

returns.description: True if value is prime, false otherwise.

doc.name: isPrime

doc.comment:

doc.description: Linearly interpolate a number to a target according to a delta.
doc.name: lerp

doc.description: Determine if input is an event.

doc.name: isEvent
